docs.snippet: Nine years after the assassination of Lebanese statesman Rafik al-Hariri, the trial of four men accused of his killing opens on Thursday. But the defendants are on the run, bombers are back on Beirut streets and a new era of justice which the tria...
docs.lead_paragraph: Nine years after the assassination of Lebanese statesman Rafik al-Hariri, the trial of four men accused of his killing opens on Thursday. But the defendants are on the run, bombers are back on Beirut streets and a new era of justice which the trial was meant to introduce to Lebanon remains elusive.

headline.main: Justice Elusive as Lebanon's Hariri Trial Opens Without Accused
headline.print_headline: Justice Elusive as Lebanon's Hariri Trial Opens Without Accused
